title: What is the point of placing matches?
body: If you win 8 out of 10 games and do very well why would you get placed in bronze 5?

replies.body: Your rank from last season + your MMR + MMR of people you played with + MMR of people you played against + you always end up placed a bit lower than last year. There is quite a lot of things that impacts your final placement.
Why? Seems really redundant. Why not just make EVERYONE, including those that were in challenger, start from the VERY VERY bottom, in like Paper Bag 5 ? that would be the fairest way to go about it.
What Vulgarion said. It's meant to keep challenger player playing against better players, so they don't stomp new players/low elo players for no reason.

It would also make the first like, 2 to 3 months of every season a living hell since Bronze players would need to contest against the cream of the crop, that is, quite honestly, an ATROCIOUS idea.

> [{quoted}](name=QUANTEYES,realm=NA,application-id=osqw6G4M,discussion-id=fgUeM22I,comment-id=00000000,timestamp=2016-10-02T15:36:46.164+0000)
>
> Why? Seems really redundant. Why not just make EVERYONE, including those that were in challenger, start from the VERY VERY bottom, in like Paper Bag 5 ? that would be the fairest way to go about it.

Placement matches factor in last season's rating along with this season's and the preseason. Our [Ranked Play FAQ](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/204010760-Ranked-Play-FAQ#h12q1) mentions this:

>Every season introduces lots of changes to various parts of League of Legends gameplay. Because of this, we perform a soft reset on ranked standings. This means that though your previous season's performance carries weight, along with your placement matches, in most cases you can expect to be seeded lower than where you ended the previous season.

Let me know if you have any other questions.
